heroHeader.en: Get real-time updates on the weather conditions on the red planet, with data sourced directly from NASA's Curiosity Rover.

solNumber.en: A Martian sol (short for 'solar day') is the equivalent of a day on Mars, which is slightly longer than a day on Earth. The number displayed here is the number of solar days since the start of Curiosity's mission.

latestUpdateDate.en: The date of the latest update from Curiosity. The latest data is usually fetched every 4-7 days.

season.en: Mars has four seasons just like Earth, but they last about twice as long. That's because it takes about two Earth years for Mars to go around the Sun.

marsDate.en: Earth date converted to Darian Calendar. The year is divided into 24 months. Each month has 4 weeks. Each week has 7 days: Sol, Luna, Mars, Mercurius, Jupiter, Venus, Saturnus.
